content: Could be hard in reverse mode, however it is a fun concept.

The statement on the first line "and then take the character with as index the second number." is not very clear and feels malformed. 
Perhaps "and get the character by indexing the name with the second number" is clearer, but truthfully I suggest the first paragraph may require wider restructuring.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: clash easily achievable in less than 5 minutes, the statement is clear. it's a fun clash for me

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: Still improvements to be made on the contribution
Cool !
I would make the following improvements:
This is fun

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: would work as a fastest but not a reverse. remove it if you agree.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Je n'avais pas encore rencontré ce jeu sur le site. Sympa à faire !

This is a fun challenge! I'm not sure it's suitable for Reverse; the process is fairly unintuitive without the goal statement, especially for someone who does not have English as a first language. 

In your Goal, 'and then take the character with as index the second number' doesn't quite make sense -  'and then take the character whose index is the second number' would be my recommendation.
This challenge was fun :)
i loved this challenge. but firstly i did not understood,  when i read carefuly and looked the test cases, i understood it

* Your goal statement is incomprehensible. I saw you were working on it, but I'll give you an example of a (imo) clear explanation. 

"You need to decrypt the given text [[hidden]]. Every two numbers get converted to one character as follows: convert the first number to its name, and take the character with as index the second number. The two numbers correspond to that character.

For example: the number pair 23 would be converted to a single "o" (Format this as constant. I forgot how.). First we convert the 2 to "two", and then we take the 3rd character in that word: "o". "

I changed your example, because having two times the same number only adds to the confusion.

* The example in the goal statement doesn't correspond with your test cases. In the goal statement, you start counting at 1 (the 2nd letter of "two" is "w"). In the tests, you start counting at 0 (the 4th letter of "eight" is "t"). I think you're starting at index 1 for other test cases too.

There's more stuff that needs to be done, but the first point is the most important work, because that will get people to understand what this challenge is.
I don't think this clash is suitable for shortest

Goal section
* I don't understand your explanation.

Input section and Output section
* Please follow the stub generator classification and describe the inputs and outputs as strings instead of array(char).
* Please follow the example in the contribution guidelines in presenting these sections, e.g.
<<Line 1:>> A string [[name]] which consists of the digits 0 to 9
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines

Constraints section
* I don't understand your first constraint.
* The constraints section refer to the limitations on the inputs, not on the outputs. So, please remove the second constraint.
* The third constraint explains the output requirement and has already been mentioned in the Goal section. So, please remove the third constraint.

Cases
* Tests and validators should be different.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement.
Thank you for your feedback. It certainly is. I will improve based on your comments.
the 3rd constraint seems unnecessary ('Second number in each pair < length of first number written out, or pair is '99'")

I also made minor adjustments to the input, output statements and removed it from reverse
don't think anyone would be able to figure this one out without the problem statement
Thank you for your feedback.
Tell me when you finished changing, i'll review again ;)
